result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shailey Marie Huron

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:28 PM Defendant Shailey Marie Huron in court.  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock in court for Shailey Marie Huron.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 067220,
Payable Number: 63204,
Receipt Number: 22R 009202,
Amount: $20.00
Initial Appearance set for 09/19/22 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 2

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.

1:07 PM Defendant Shailey Marie Huron appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.   

Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping and Resisting or Obstructing an Officer.
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BY THE COURT: 
Court will adopt the request for the $1,500 signature bond as requested by the State with the conditions as stated on the record.
